author: Ethan Johnson
comment: I really like the idea but it has a long ways to go yet. Being able to map the swypes and taps to hotkeys on the computer-especially ones that control a tasker on the computer-would be fantastic. I'd donate to that no problem. It's oriented sideways on the Moto 360 btw. Up is right, right is down, etc. And the pattern doesn't fit the screen properly. I'd have given this a one or a two star of it wasn't sill in beta testing.
title: It needs lots of work yet

author: Gavin Ovsak
comment: I can see the messages streaming to my device (N5) but I'm having trouble connecting it to the desktop client (.jar on windows). Both are on same wifi (public but past a portal), but there is no where to put the IP address on the app (only port option). Suggestions?

reply.author: Mark Schramm
reply.content: Since version 1.1 the messages are sent to the whole subnet (e.g. every computer with an IP of 192.168.1.xxx). Make sure port 41235 is reachable and you are using version 0.1a from the website.

title: Has potential

author: Max Sergeyenko
comment: Gestures is when u wave your hand or twist your wrist. And it is possible to do so. So do so. Instead of this stupid non making sense thing xD. and let us launch any file on PC. THEN it becomes 10000000% usable :)
title: Um that's not gestures....

author: Paul S
comment: This works brilliantly but is predictably of very limited use when it can send only five different keystrokes to the PC. Can't wait for a customisable version so I can for instance send the keypress 'C' to my media player software (which pauses and unpauses music playing on my PC). Will definitely upgrade this to a five-star review if and when I can do this from my wrist! Edited to add: oh, just realised this only seems to work if the mobile app is running in the foreground - would be far better if it could work with it in the background on the mobile.
title: Can't wait for updates

author: Abdalla Elmedny
comment: Am impressed, it works surprisingly well for my moto 360. Even tho the design isn't amazing, but it definitely does the job perfectly. Also having viberations on watch touch would be really nice.

author: Milan Schneider
comment: It works on my watch (sideways and off centre) and phone but I can't install the latest windows file.
title: Can't install the windows file

author: John Mason-Smith
title: Please add support for the Moto 360!

author: Álvaro Souza
comment: It is displayed sideways on my Moto 360. Also it needs a better UI
title: Good, but...

author: bob flay
comment: I didn't know how to use it on Mac

author: Clayton Bigsby
comment: Can anybody make a wear remote so I can fully control my android like the HID on moga?

author: Konstantin Krehl
comment: Unable to exit on the wear device

reply.author: Mark Schramm
reply.content: cover the watch with your palm
